subject: Re: [junit] how to test if something is thread safe?
msgSnippet: ... * Immutable classes are always thread safe. Careful with this one. Immutable objects that have mutable objects as a parameter to a method can be a
messageBody:
--- John Brewer <jbrewer@...> wrote:
* Immutable classes are always thread safe.<BR>

Careful with this one. Immutable objects that have mutable objects as a
parameter to a method can be a problem....

The Sun folks were pretty good about the immutable classes, so there
aren't any examples there. Classes that implement the GOF Flyweight
pattern will be immutable, but take some sort of Context argument to
some/all methods. These methods are only thread safe if the Context is
thread safe. I supposed we could debate whether Flyweights count as
being immutable....

Regards,

Rob
